why is this only PY3?

add a more informative comment, not just the issue, e.g. ensure round-trip pickle compat

comments.body: Is there a reason you're just adding new code instead of separating out code from that test into a new one (i.e. split the test into two, the passing part, and the flaky part)?
Diff may be somewhat misleading but I essentially copied the entire test over and deleted the part from `set_xlim` onwards from original test
should we not see subtraction of code then as well?
@jreback : I looked at it again, and I see why it's just an add.  `git` thinks @WillAyd just inserted a second copy of the first half of the original test.
I believe the random ints for `deltas` are what can cause the failures.
Potentially, though probably best to investigate after this PR.

        ts = np.array([(t + timedelta(minutes=int(x))).time() for x in deltas])
        df = DataFrame({'a': np.random.randn(len(ts)),
